marketNews.title: Government Releases New Waste-to-Energy Regulation
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto has issued Presidential Regulation No. 109/2025 concerning the processing of waste into electricity (PSEL or waste-to-energy) on 10 October 2025. The new regulation has several important changes compared to the previous regulation, Presidential Regulation No. 35/2018. Key differences include: Increase in the electricity purchase price by PLN. The new regulation sets the purchase price for electricity from PSEL operators to PLN at 20 US cents per kWh for all capacities, up from the previous range of approximately 13 US cents per kWh depending on PSEL capacity. Contract duration of 30 years. The new regulation defines a 30-year power purchase agreement (PPA) period for electricity sales from PSEL operators to PLN, starting when the PSEL reaches commercial operation. Previously, no contract duration was stipulated. Elimination of the tipping fee. The higher electricity purchase price is accompanied by the removal of the waste management fee (tipping fee). Previously, operators received a maximum tipping fee of IDR 500,000 per ton of waste as compensation for waste processing services. The regulation also defines the role of Danantara in PSEL projects: selecting the business entity that will develop and manage the PSEL, and investing in the commercial, financial, and risk-management aspects of the PSEL. PSEL operators can be formed through cooperation between local governments and state-owned enterprises (BUMN), regional-owned enterprises (BUMD), or private parties. Danantara CEO Rosan Perkasa Roeslani claimed on Thursday (16/10) that there are already 107 prospective waste-to-energy investors in Indonesia, with 53 domestic and 54 foreign investors. According to analysis by the Ministry of Environment, ten cities are ready to implement the projects: Jakarta, Tangerang, Bekasi, Bandung, Yogyakarta, Semarang, Surabaya, Medan, Bali and Makassar. Key Takeaway: The new revenue scheme – higher purchase price from PLN but no tipping fee – together with a long-term electricity sales contract provides greater business certainty and improves the financial viability of PSEL projects. On the Indonesia Stock Exchange, several issuers already have or plan exposure to the waste-to-energy industry or its ecosystem, such as $TOBA, $OASA, $MHKI, $HGII, and $BIPI.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics to Know
marketNews.content: Indonesian government bond yields for the 10-year tenor fell by 6.6 basis points to 5.956% on Thursday (16/10), marking the lowest level since January 2021. The yield decline was driven by expectations of interest-rate cuts and strong domestic demand for sovereign bonds. President Prabowo Subianto said on Wednesday (15/10) that he has instructed Danantara to reduce the number of state-owned enterprises (BUMN) from around 1,000 to about 200. He also noted that regulations have been changed to allow expatriates and non-Indonesians to lead BUMN. President Prabowo’s nephew and President Director of PT Arsari Tambang, Aryo Djojohadikusumo, said on Wednesday (15/10) that the company is discussing the acquisition of mining assets in Canada, targeting a transaction value of IDR 7 trillion, expected to close in June 2026. Arsari Tambang is a tin mining company operating mainly in Bangka Belitung, according to Reuters. Kontan reported that heavy-equipment manufacturer LiuGong Indonesia plans to build a heavy-equipment production facility worth USD 317 million in the Artha Industrial Hill area, Karawang Barat, with an annual capacity of 5,000 units by 2030. The Ministry of Industry recorded two other companies committing investment for plant expansion: PT Qingtuo Automotive Manufacturing Indonesia with an investment of USD 330 million, and PT Komatsu Indonesia – an affiliate of United Tractors ($UNTR) – with an investment of USD 13.5 million. Geoprima Solusi ($GPSO) stated in a clarification to the IDX that PT PIMSF Pulogadung will acquire 45.45% of the company’s shares held by existing controller Karnadi Margaka at an average price of IDR 67.66 per share, totaling IDR 20.5 billion. PT PIMSF Pulogadung previously purchased 170 million GPSO shares at an average price of IDR 59 per share on 14 October 2025, raising its direct ownership to 25.49%. GPSO also mentioned that it cannot yet confirm the ultimate beneficial owner (UBO) of the company; however, based on the capital structure, the strongest UBO candidate is Kurniawan Eddy Tjokro. Boston Furniture Industries ($SOFA) announced that its subsidiary PT Pratama Satya Prima has added a new line of business in waste management and power generation. Bloomberg reported that the government will impose a new export levy on cocoa beans starting 22 October 2025, ranging from 2.5% to 7.5%. The levy will be paid to the Plantation Fund Management Agency and used for farmer support programs. Meanwhile, the export duty rate to customs will be reduced from a maximum of 15% to a maximum of 7.5%, keeping the total cost (export levy plus export duty) at 15%.

tickerNews.title: SMRA reports 9M25 marketing sales up 34% YoY, reaching 71% of 2025 target
tickerNews.content: $SMRA: Summarecon Agung recorded marketing sales of IDR 1.39 trillion in 3Q25 (+49% YoY, +8% QoQ). This resulted in 9M25 marketing sales of IDR 3.57 trillion (+34% YoY), equal to 71% of the 2025 target of IDR 5 trillion. The residential segment contributed 76.3% of 9M25 marketing sales, followed by shophouses (20%), apartments (1.9%), land parcels (1.6%), and offices/commercial (0.2%).

tickerNews.title: FUTR secures strategic agreement with PLN Bali for 130 MW solar project
tickerNews.content: $FUTR: Chief Executive Officer of Futura Energi Global, Tonny Agus Mulyantono, said the company has reached a strategic agreement with PT PLN Bali to develop a 130 MW solar power plant (PLTS). Previously, FUTR clarified to the IDX that it plans to develop a PLTS with a potential capacity of 130 MW in 2026. Tonny also mentioned that FUTR will soon sign a memorandum of understanding with a strategic partner from China in solar technology and energy storage systems.

tickerNews.title: PTRO shareholder Erwin Ciputra purchases 600,000 shares at IDR 6,875 each
tickerNews.content: $PTRO: Petrosea Commissioner Erwin Ciputra bought 600,000 PTRO shares at an average price of IDR 6,875 per share on 15 October 2025. The total transaction value was approximately IDR 4.1 billion. After this transaction, Erwin Ciputra’s ownership in PTRO increased from 0.0997% to 0.1056%.

tickerNews.title: PACK announces rights issue with mandatory convertible bonds at IDR 100 per share
tickerNews.content: $PACK: Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama announced that the execution price for its rights issue in the form of mandatory convertible bonds (OWK) is IDR 100 per share. In this corporate action, PACK will issue a maximum of approximately 32.6 billion shares, potentially raising up to IDR 3.26 trillion. Every holder of 5 PACK shares will receive 102 rights, with 1 right equivalent to 1 OWK. The maximum dilution effect of this action reaches 95.33%. PACK’s controlling shareholder, PT Eco Energi Perkasa, stated it will exercise all its rights and act as a standby buyer. The proceeds will be used by PACK to provide loans to subsidiaries for the purchase of shares of PT Konutara Sejati and PT Karyatama Konawe Utara, as well as for working-capital financing. Cum rights will trade on the regular market and be negotiated on 28 November 2025, while the rights trading period is scheduled for 4–10 December 2025 and the conversion date of OWK into shares is 17 December 2026.

tickerNews.title: WIFI frequency auction winner announced for 1.4 GHz band
tickerNews.content: $WIFI: The Ministry of Communication and Digital on Wednesday (15/10) announced the winner of the 1.4 GHz frequency band auction. PT Telemedia Komunikasi Pratama, operating under Solusi Sinergi Digital, won the right to use the 1.4 GHz band for Region I covering Java, Maluku, and Papua. PT Eka Mas Republik (MyRepublic), operating under Dian Swastatika Sentosa ($DSSA), obtained the rights for Regions II and III.

tickerNews.title: DEWA shareholder Madhani Talatah Nusantara sells 816 million shares at IDR 75 each
tickerNews.content: $DEWA: Darma Henwa shareholder PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara sold 816 million DEWA shares on 10 October 2025 at an average price of IDR 75 per share. The total transaction value was IDR 61.2 billion. After the transaction, PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara’s direct ownership in DEWA decreased from 8.07% to 6.07%.

tickerNews.title: PIPA plans mandatory tender offer for 47.47% of shares at IDR 21 per share
tickerNews.content: $PIPA: New controlling shareholder Multi Makmur Lemindo, PT Morris Capital Indonesia, plans to conduct a mandatory tender offer for 47.47% of PIPA shares at an offer price of IDR 21 per share. PIPA states that the tender will run for 30 calendar days, starting one day after the public disclosure on 15 October 2025. After this corporate action is completed, PT Morris Capital Indonesia’s ownership in PIPA could increase from 48.88% to 96.35%. This action follows the completion of Morris Capital’s acquisition of 43.78% of PIPA shares at an average price of IDR 10.6 per share, totaling IDR 15.9 billion on 10 October 2025. Morris Capital intends to develop PIPA as part of a national energy distribution ecosystem, covering fuel trading and logistics.

tickerNews.title: SOFA subsidiary adds waste management and power generation business
tickerNews.content: Boston Furniture Industries ($SOFA) announced that its subsidiary, PT Pratama Satya Prima, has added a new line of business in waste management and power generation.
